title: Here’s why you should invest in a Dell Latitude laptop
author: sponsored
article: These days, the demand for a mobile business PC that can tackle whatever productivity tasks users throw at it is higher than ever before, and Dell has answered that call with its Latitude device lineup. These laptops are superb options if you’re in need of a top-notch ultrabook, but what exactly is it that makes them so excellent? Here’s a look at some of the things that make Latitude devices such great choices.

The first thing that makes Dell Latitude laptops excellent is the AI-driven Dell Optimizer feature that improves application performance and battery run time, enhances your audio, ensures you have the best network connectivity, and allows for a faster and more convenient sign-in experience. Dell Optimizer is comprised of four different “Express” tools: ExpressConnect, ExpressResponse, ExpressSign-in, and ExpressCharge.

First up is ExpressConnect, which automatically joins the strongest access point in the device’s proximity and directs bandwidth to conferencing applications. This ensures that you’re always enjoying the best speeds possible..

Next is ExpressResponse, which allows you to boost an app’s speed and stability by selecting them as favorites. This can be incredibly helpful when you’re trying to use an application to get as much work done as possible in a short amount of time.

ExpressSign-in is a superb security tool that uses the laptop’s webcam to auto-detect when you’re at the device and when you’re away. When you sit down to work, your device will automatically wake up so that you can get started right away. When you get up, the device will automatically lock itself, ensuring that nobody can access your data while you’re away.

Lastly, there’s ExpressCharge, which extends runtime and improves battery performance by adapting to your patterns. You can get up to 80% charge within an hour. You can get the same amount of charge within 40 minutes if you’re using a 9000-series device.

In addition to the “Express” tools, there’s also an Intelligent Audio feature that enhances your audio quality and reduces background noises. This makes it so that you can hear and be heard better on calls.

Secondly, you can outfit many of Dell’s Latitude laptops with powerful Intel 11th Gen processors. Not only are these processors more capable than previous generations, but they’re also more power efficient, meaning that your device will run quieter and cooler than competing devices. This also means that Dell Latitude laptops have excellent battery life that will last you through the workday without any issues.

You also get to enjoy the benefits of Intel’s Xe Graphics hardware if you opt for these processors. Intel Xe Graphics outperforms all other forms of integrated graphics hardware on the market by a wide margin, and while it’s not quite as powerful as a dedicated GPU, it will still handle business-focused visual applications like editing photos without issues. You can even enjoy some light gaming when the workday is done as well.

When you consider that these powerful pieces of hardware are paired up with plenty of memory, storage, and the power of Dell Optimizer, it’s clear to see why Dell’s Latitude lineup is such a top performer for productivity.

Another excellent feature of Dell’s Latitude laptops is the fact that they have great connectivity in terms of Wi-Fi, 4G LTE and 5G, and ports. When it comes to Wi-Fi, Latitude laptops are fully compatible with the latest Wi-Fi 6E (Future proof, Wi-Fi 6E capable on 9420 and 5000 Series) standard that offers users better network speed, stability, security, and range. This means that if you own a Wi-Fi 6 router, you can enjoy all of the great benefits of Wi-Fi 6 on your Dell Latitude.

When it comes to getting connected while on the go, Dell Latitude devices are equipped with either 4G LTE or 5G for maximum speeds while you’re away from Wi-Fi hotspots. This means that you never have to stop being productive when you’re away from your main work hub.

Latitude laptops also come with an excellent suite of ports. In addition to your standard 3.5mm audio slots and ports for external displays, Latitude devices also feature several USB-A 3.2 ports, Thunderbolt 4 slots, and memory card readers that allow you to add more storage to your laptop. These ports give users tons of freedom to hook up peripheral devices and accessories like USB hubs, adapters, mobile devices, and more.

Dell Latitude devices are also amazing for folks who need to work collaboratively. You can enjoy superior video calls with FHD and advanced cameras that brighten and sharpen images in any light, which will improve your experience with work meetings. 9000-series devices also come equipped with the industry’s first webcam SafeShutter that can be opened or closed whenever you wish. You can also take control of privacy with secure camera and mic mute keys. The built-in speakerphone and high-quality mics, bolstered by Intelligent Audio, are also perfect for enhancing teamwork.

Less expensive clamshells and pricier, touch-enabled convertibles both have a place in the laptop market, and the form factor that will work best for you may not work best for someone else. After all, everyone’s laptop preferences are largely dependent on the type of work you’re doing and the budget you’ve got to work with.

Dell understands this, and has aimed to satisfy everyone by offering Latitude devices in both types of configurations. Whether you need the flexibility and versatility of a 2-in-1 or you’d prefer to go with a traditional clamshell design, Dell has an excellent Latitude laptop available for you.

There are many great business laptops available these days, but with their 11th Gen Intel CPUs and Xe Graphics, lots of RAM and storage, excellent Wi-Fi and port connectivity, and multiple different form factors, we think that you won’t find anything better than Dell’s Latitude line if you’re in need of a productivity device. If you’re interested in picking one up yourself, head over to Dell’s website to browse all of the different configurations available.
